text: The 2009–10 season of the Slovak First League (also known as 1. liga) is the seventeenth season of the league since its establishment. It began in late July 2009 and ended in May 2010. ==Team changes from 2008–09== *Promoted in Corgoň Liga: ↑Senica×↑ *Relegated from Corgoň Liga: ↓Zlaté Moravce↓ *Promoted in 1. liga: ↑Púchov↑, ↑Dolný Kubín↑, ↑Liptovský Mikuláš↑ *Relegated from 1. liga: ↓Humenné↓, ↓Košice ↓, ↓Dunajská Streda ↓ × - Senica merged with Inter Bratislava ===Stadia and locations=== ==League table== ==Top goalscorers== Updated through games played on 29 May 2010; Source: ;16 goals * Karol Pavelka (FC ViOn Zlaté Moravce) ;13 goals * Peter Kuračka (FC ViOn Zlaté Moravce) ;11 goals * Patrik Čarnota (MFK Dolný Kubín) ;9 goals * Ruslan Lyubarskyi (MFK Zemplín Michalovce) ;8 goals * Martin Luhový (FK Púchov) ;7 goals * Dušan Sninský (MFK Zemplín Michalovce) * Jorge Salinas (AS Trenčín) * Filip Hlohovský (AS Trenčín) ;6 goals * Peter Tomko (MFK Tatran Liptovský Mikuláš) * Ján Chovanec (FK Púchov) * Štefan Ondrička (FK Púchov) * David Depetris (AS Trenčín) * Fanendo Adi (AS Trenčín) * Róbert Szegedi (FK LAFC Lučenec) * Róbert Tomko (FC ViOn Zlaté Moravce) ==See also== *2009–10 Slovak Superliga ==References== ==External links== * Slovak FA official site Category:2. title: 2009–10 Slovak First League
